alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 12:30PM EDT until March 28 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania... Blair County in central Pennsylvania... Cambria County in central Pennsylvania... Western Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania... Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Somerset County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 145 PM EDT. * At 1227 PM EDT, The leading edge of several bands of dangerous snow squalls were located along a line extending from Altoona to Ski Gap to Blue Knob State Park to Buffalo Mills to near Lake Gordon, moving east southeast at 20 mph. Additional brief snow squalls were occurring east of Interstate 99 and along the Pennsylvania Turnpike. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 170. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 101 to 187. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 41. Locations impacted include... Altoona, Johnstown, Huntingdon, Somerset, Hollidaysburg, Windber, Ebensburg, Bedford, Nanty-Glo, Portage, Meyersdale and McConnellsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If traveling on a highway, find the nearest exit or rest area and park safely away from traffic. Allow snow squalls to pass before attempting to resume travel. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Somerset
